entry.title: Including @OData.publish:true on v4 OData service.
entry.content:
I have created 2 Odata services which I intend to use one on Fiori app, and the other one of non-sap middleware in which contains the following:

Data definition, Behaviour definition, Service binding, Service definition, Class. 

 

Do I still need to declare the annotation @odata.publish: true if the Local Service Endpoint of the Service Binding is already published?

entry.title: How to use local copy parameters html5 application on work zone advanced such as adding variant ID
entry.content:
Hello,

We have Work Zone Advanced and have built and deployed various HTML5 apps via Business Application Studio running on Cloud Foundry using OData v4. No backend content to systems such as S/4HANA, all local to BTP. 

We are creating local copies of the deployed dynamic applications to manage dynamic content for counters and titles. We are attempting to have the applications open with preselected filters but are having issues. 

  1. Cannot use operators or regular expressions for filtering fields and sorting in the parameters with the content manager local copy of the application.
    • We have attempted various ways in both the Navigation and Visualization tabs for setting filter and sorting with only success with single values and equals as the operator. For example, we cannot find a way to filter for filter = <empty>
  2. As an alternate method we attempted to follow instructions to map a variant as part of the parameters, however this was also not successful.
    • We collected the variant id from dev tools > network > changes?sap-language=en and collecting the filename such as 
      • fileName: "id_1754739886907_236_flVariant"
      • fileType: "ctrl_variant"
      • layer: "PUBLIC"
    • We followed the guides to add the parameter variable such as sap-ui-fe-variant-id and others in the link below as well as variantKey, however none of which worked. This could be due to potentially a wrong variant id however we only see one fileName captured in the Network during a variant save event as described above. 
      • https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/468a97775123488ab3345a0c48cadd8f/4132ffa02f1148058a78dfb11c8567b0.html 

 

The guidance and documentation on the usages of the navigation and visualization parameters within the work zone advance content manager UI is not clear. The general question is there clear guidance on how to setup parameters, what parameters can be used, how to open the app with a defined variant etc.?

entry.title: CPI Perform Patch and Post in oData Batch
entry.content:
Hi

I want to use SAP CPI to POST and PATCH text blocks on a delivery in batch mode 

These links seem to imply that it is possible Patch   Post

The post process seems to work using the following payload for the oData v2 connector

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<batchParts>
<batchChangeSet>
<batchChangeSetPart>
<method>POST</method>
<A_OutbDeliveryHeaderText>
<A_OutbDeliveryHeaderTextType>
<DeliveryDocument>83784033</DeliveryDocument>
<TextElement>Z001</TextElement>
<Language>EN</Language>
<TextElementText>Za001 License Plate</TextElementText>
</A_OutbDeliveryHeaderTextType>
</A_OutbDeliveryHeaderText>
</batchChangeSetPart>
<batchChangeSetPart>
<method>POST</method>
<A_OutbDeliveryHeaderText>
<A_OutbDeliveryHeaderTextType>
<DeliveryDocument>83784033</DeliveryDocument>
<TextElement>Z002</TextElement>
<Language>EN</Language>
<TextElementText>Za002 Trailer Number</TextElementText>
</A_OutbDeliveryHeaderTextType>
</A_OutbDeliveryHeaderText>
</batchChangeSetPart>
</batchChangeSet>
</batchParts>
 
However when I replace the POST with PATCH I get an exception error from the odata 
 
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<error xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/ado/2007/08/dataservices/metadata">
<code>0050569259751EE4BA9710043F8A5115</code>
<message xml:lang="en">In the context of Data Services an unknown internal server error occurred</message>
<innererror>
<transactionid>eb453173445c4d93b59a3bd9a5dd2640</transactionid>
<timestamp>20250813101554.5083050</timestamp>
<Error_Resolution>
<SAP_Transaction>For backend administrators: use ADT feed reader "SAP Gateway Error Log" or run transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG on SAP Gateway hub system and search for entries with the timestamp above for more details</SAP_Transaction>
<SAP_Note>See SAP Note 1797736 for error analysis (https://service.sap.com/sap/support/notes/1797736)</SAP_Note>
</Error_Resolution>
</innererror>
</error>
The odata is configured as shown below

Please can you give some guidance as to where I am going wrong

 

Thanks

entry.title: The Data Service Request is required to be conditional. Try using the "If-Match" headernull
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am trying to update a Custom Field of a Billing Document (aka customer invoice) on Public Cloud from SAP Integration Suite.

SAP provides 2 different APIs for Billing Documents:
ODATA V2: https://api.sap.com/api/API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV/overview
ODATA V4: https://api.sap.com/api/sap-s4-CE_BILLINGDOCUMENT_0001-v1/overview

Unlike for Sales Orders, where the V2 can be used for PATCH calls, for Billing Documents, only the ODATA V4 has the option to PATCH the object.
However, when I try using the ODATA V4 adaptor in Integration Suite, it gives the following error:
"The Data Service Request is required to be conditional. Try using the "If-Match" headernull [HTTP/1.1 428 Precondition Required]."

My steps are: 

Request Reply: ODATA V4 - a simple GET call to retrieve the E-tag in the header for the given Billing Docuement
Content Modifier: Create Body and Add "If-Match" on the Header from the E-tag
Request Reply: ODATA V4 - PATCH to update a custom field

But the PATCH call fails:

I have also tried to set the "If-Match" to *, but I get the same error.

The same steps for the Sales Order ODATA V2 is working, but I the Billing Document ODATA V4 gives me the above error.

Am I missing something, or am I doing something wrong?
Or is the ODATA V4 adaptor broken?

Any tips would be appreciated.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Using SAP CPI to Perform POST Calls on SAP Datasphere OData API
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

In my current scenario, I need to perform both GET and POST operations on an OData API exposed from SAP Datasphere. Querying records works fine using OAuth 2.0 with the Authorization Code grant type.

Now, I have another use case where I need to push data from SAP CPI into Datasphere for integration purposes. While I know that data loading can be done using the JDBC adapter in CPI, I would prefer an API-based approach.

The key challenge I’m facing is around executing a POST request to insert records directly into Datasphere tables. Does Datasphere support inserting data into its tables via APIs, or is there a workaround required to achieve this?

If anyone has implemented this in a project, I would really appreciate your insights.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: SAP UI5 drag and drop the column name move to new position only
Referencing New Entity in Batch Request
entry.content:
Dear Community

I have a question on how to reference new entity that will be created in the same changeset from a subsequent request.

■Goal

・Creating a billing document

・Referencing new entity ( Billing Document Number that will be created) and posting it to accounting

・If posting it to accounting failed, the billing document should not be created at all (keep atomicity)

--request-separator
Content-Type:multipart/mixed;boundary=changeset
content-id:1

--changeset
Content-Type:application/http
content-id:1

POST BillingDocument/SAP__self.CreateFromSDDocument HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
if-match:*

{"_Reference":[{"SDDocument":"80000858"}]}
--changeset
Content-Type:application/http
content-id:2

POST $1/SAP__self.PostToAccounting HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json
if-match:*


--changeset--
--request-separator--

 ■Problem

$1 did not work saying "Content ID '$1' is not valid".

--06CCB59B6843C50D33ABAC61925ECE6E0
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Length: 959
content-transfer-encoding: binary
content-id: 2

HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Content-Type: application/json;odata.metadata=minimal;charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 778
sap-cache-control: -u
content-language: en
odata-version: 4.0

{"error":{"code":"/IWCOR/CX_OD_URI_NOT_MATCHING/42010AEF0CEE1EDCA3E48032225B84BB","message":"Content ID '$1' is not valid","@SAP__common.ExceptionCategory":"Client_Error","innererror":{"ErrorDetails":{"@SAP__common.Application":{"ComponentId":"SD-BIL","ServiceRepository":"SRVD_A2X","ServiceId":"API_BILLINGDOCUMENT","ServiceVersion":"0001"},"@SAP__common.TransactionId":"600414ADECD10170E0068A6D084EE041","@SAP__common.Timestamp":"20250822021139.726132","@SAP__common.ErrorResolution":{"Analysis":"Use ADT feed reader \"SAP Gateway Error Log\" or run transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG on SAP Gateway hub system and search for entries with the timestamp above for more details","Note":"See SAP Note 1797736 for error analysis (https://service.sap.com/sap/support/notes/1797736)"}}}}}
--06CCB59B6843C50D33ABAC61925ECE6E0--

 I would appreciate it if you would let me know anything related to this!

Thanks&Regards

entry.title: CAP (Node.js) OData V2 Batch Request using SAP Cloud SDK – How to capture all errors in a changeset?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m working on a use case where I need to send a batch of update/create/delete requests from a SAP CAP (Node.js) backend to an SAP S/4HANA system. I'm using the SAP Cloud SDK and the Business Accelerator Hub to build and send the OData V2 (using odata-v2-adapter) batch requests.

Here’s what I’ve achieved so far:

  • I’m able to send multiple requests (update/create/delete) within a single batch.
  • To ensure transactional behavior, I wrap all these requests into one changeset.
  • This works well from a transactional standpoint: if any request fails, nothing is committed in S/4.

However, here’s the problem, when one request inside the changeset fails, only a single error is returned, and the rest of the requests are not processed. This behavior is expected according to OData V2 specs and SAP Cloud SDK documentation:

  • “The body of a ChangeSet response is either a response for all the successfully processed change request within the ChangeSet [...] or a single response indicating a failure of the entire ChangeSet.” (OData V2)
  • “If the execution of any request within a changeset fails, the whole changeset will be reflected as an error in the response.” (SAP Cloud SDK)

What I tried:

  • Splitting requests into multiple changesets (one per request) within the same batch allows me to retrieve individual errors, but I lose transactional integrity, some changes are committed while others fail.
  • I also explored the continueOnError option from the odata-v2-adapter, but it only applies between multiple changesets, not within a single changeset. So, again, it doesn’t help with my use case. (SAP Community Q&A)

What I’m looking for:

  • Is there any way (official or workaround) to get detailed errors for all requests without sacrificing atomicity?
  • Alternatively, is there a way to simulate or validate a batch in a “check” or “test” mode, without actually executing it in the S/4HANA backend, just to detect all potential errors?
  • Or is the recommended approach, as suggested by CAP documentation, to implement strong input validation before triggering the batch, to ensure that it will succeed?

Any insights, ideas, or shared experiences would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Duplicates in draft on test tenant - public cloud
entry.content:
Hi community,

I have created a managed with draft application in the public cloud. ( list report )
I tested it on the dev tenant and then transported it to the test tenant.
The testing on the dev tenant were without errors.
On the test tenant I'm encoutering the following error:
All items that i create, get the same draft uuid. Meaning once i press go I see no data as I get a duplicate error message or if I continue with the create message, i get an page error as again, my table contains duplicates.

Duplicate error:
Failed to get contexts for /sap/opu/odata4/sap/z_billing/srvd/sap/z_billing/0001/Billinginfo with start index 0 and length 30 - Error: Duplicate key predicate: (ParentId=fa163e0b-7372-1fe0-a0fd-9f1480095443,IsActiveEntity=false)

If I look into my odata response with the dev tools, I can see all my created items, still in draft mode, with a non unique draft uuid.

I'm thinking about trying out late numbering to fix the issue, but I don't understand why the issue happens in the first place.
It works fine on the dev system.

a)Any suggestions ?

Further cloud questions related to this issue.
b)How can i delete data from my draft table from the test tenant ?
  Do i need to call an api service that can delete data or build a data managing app ?
c)If I'm not mistaken, it is not possible to look into the databases on the test tenant, correct ?

Kind regards
JT

entry.title: Error fetching OData V4 services in VSCode
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to publish an annotation driven Fiori application written in OData V4 through VSCode on a private cloud system. I published the service through /IWFND/V4_ADMIN and can see in ADT that the service binding is active and the preview is working.

I have added my system. When I test the connection I get the following messages in the console:

[info] This SAP System <XXX> returned 423 V2 and 0 V4 services.
[error] The V4 request failed with error: Request failed with status code 404.
 
I assume in this context that 404 stands for "not found". Does anyone have any idea where can I enable it?
 
All the best,
Ben

entry.title: What's the best way to call or use my custom Data Provider Class on my v4 OData service?
entry.content:
Since v4 Odata service uses standard class, what's the best approach on calling or using the custom model for data provider class?

Context: My Odata service is connected to custom fiori app. Also, i have created a custom class that contains custom logic. My behavior definition also calls the custom class that I've had created.

Objective: When an action button is used/pressed, I would like to call the class ZCL_QM_TEST which I would like to call the specific action which is get_entity.

Behavior definition code:

managed implementation in class ZCL_TEST unique;
strict ( 2 );

define behavior for Z_TEST_CDS
persistent table qals
lock master
authorization master ( instance )

{
   create;
   update;
   delete;
   field( mandatory ) InpsectionLot;

   action get_entity result [0..*] $self;
}

entry.title: Is there a way to get the list of all instructors through API ?
entry.content: Is there a way to get the list of all instructors through ODATA API ?

entry.title: How to update multiple entities in a single OData $batch request.
entry.content:
• I am sending one  $batch request with multipart/mixed format.

  • Inside, you created one changeset with 3 PATCH requests.

  • SAP will execute all 3 updates together.

  • If one fails (e.g. invalid IBAN), the whole changeset is rolled back.

 

 

--batch_001
Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary=changeset_001

--changeset_001
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

PATCH A_BusinessPartner('XXXX') HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
"BusinessPartnerCategory": "X",
"BusinessPartnerGrouping": "XXXX"
}
--changeset_001
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

PATCH A_BusinessPartnerAddress(BusinessPartner='XXXX',AddressID='XXX') HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
"CityName": "Dubai",
"PostalCode": "00000"
}
--changeset_001
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

PATCH A_BusinessPartnerBank(BusinessPartner='XXXX',BankIdentification='XXXX') HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
"BankName": "XXXXXXXXX",
"IBAN": "XXXXXXXXXXX"
}

--changeset_001--
--batch_001--

entry.title: How to properly unpublish a service binding?
entry.content:
I am trying to undo and delete my OData service that has the following objects:

Data definition, Behavior definition, Service definition, Service Binding.

 

What is the proper way to unpublish the service binding in able to delete it without issues?
